feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Deviating number of table entries after ugprade to S4
entry.content:
Dear SAP-Uers,

we have done a comparisson of the no. of table entries before and after a migration to the RISE platform including an upgrade from ECC to S4/HANA.

We have found quite a few tables were the number of entries is deviating from the number on the source system, which include also some customizing tables.

We understand that during the upgrade also new customizing entries are delivered and on the other hand outdated entries are deleted, but is there some documentation what is changed during the upgrade? We would like to include this for audit reasons.

Regards

Kevin Wedding

entry.title: Document Compression in DMS.
entry.content:
We are currently using the Document Management Service, Integration Option in our production system on SAP BTP. We have observed that all documents being attached via our application are getting stored in their original size within the DMS.

We would like to understand why the documents are not being compressed before being stored in DMS. Additionally, we are looking for guidance on the following:

  1. Is document compression supported during upload/attachment in the DMS (Integration Option)?

  2. If yes, what configurations or custom implementations are required to enable compression of attachments before they are stored?

  3. Are there any recommended best practices or tools to handle this compression efficiently within the BTP ecosystem

entry.title: AFRU-APLZL all zeroes
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm putting together a REM backflush report and running into records where AFRU-APLZL is all zeroes, which breaks the join to AFVC. Does anyone know what that indicates?

entry.title: Error in ABAP Cloud - "The Use of table /SCWM/T340D is not permitted"
entry.content:
I am building a code "ready for cloud" in on premise system and code below is triggering error message "The Use of table /SCWM/T340D is not permitted" -->

METHODS unpack_outer_hu

IMPORTING

is_t340D TYPE /scwm/t340d

is_ltap TYPE /scwm/ltap

EXPORTING

ev_del_level TYPE i.

 Normally it happens when object or table is not released to ABAP Cloud, we are having this error message for several EWM objects, is there any way to release it to ABAP Cloud?

I also tried to find some CDS view to use it, but didn´t find any CDS view related with table /scwm/t340d.

ABAP Cloud EWM - Basis

entry.title: How Does Selective Data Transition (SDT) Work Technically?
entry.content:
Behind the Scenes of a Flexible S/4HANA Migration

As SAP ECC customers prepare for the transition to S/4HANA, more organizations are turning to Selective Data Transition (SDT) as a flexible alternative to Brownfield and Greenfield approaches. But how exactly does SDT work under the hood? In a recent expert session hosted by SAP’s Customer Evolution Program, speakers from SNP,  SAP, and Natuvion walked through the technical mechanics of SDT - from system creation to downtime optimization. Here’s what you need to know.

Laying the foundation: Four paths to system creation

There are different system creation scenarios, each offering varying degrees of reuse, flexibility, and innovation. The four main paths include:

  1. Shell conversion: This is the most common and recommended approach. It begins with a 1:1 copy of the existing ECC system, excluding master and transactional data, while retaining all customizing and repository objects. The resulting shell system is lightweight and can be cleaned up and aligned with the S/4HANA data model. Customers can simplify selectively and introduce SAP best practices, all without starting from scratch. It’s ideal for organizations with valuable custom developments they want to retain while still pursuing innovation.
  2. Mix-and-match approach:This approach begins with a new S/4HANA installation (not a copy of ECC), into which selected configurations and processes are imported. There are two variations: one where the system is entirely new with minimal reuse, and one where key elements from ECC are selectively brought in via transports. Mix-and-match provides more design freedom and is better suited for businesses aiming to reshape their processes more aggressively - closer to a greenfield mindset, but with less disruption.
  3. New implementation (greenfield):In a full greenfield scenario, the target S/4HANA system is built entirely from scratch. There’s no reuse of configurations or legacy structures. SDT may still be used afterward to selectively migrate relevant historical data, but the system setup phase itself is a clean start.
  4. Existing system scenario: This path is common in wave-based or phased rollouts, where a productive S/4HANA system already exists and SDT is used to gradually migrate data from additional ECC systems or entities. As the project progresses, new waves of data (e.g. additional company codes) are merged into the existing environment, supporting system consolidation over time.

Staying aligned: Managing dual maintenance and retrofit

In any long-running migration project, keeping the source and target systems synchronized is a challenge. ECC systems continue to evolve during the transition, and changes need to be reflected in the new S/4HANA environment. SAP addresses this with its retrofit process, managed via Solution Manager or Cloud ALM. Depending on the complexity, changes can be synchronized automatically, with tool assistance, or manually.

A configuration freeze shortly before go-live helps stabilize the environment and minimize risks, but effective retrofit remains essential, especially for customers with extensive customizations.

The core of it all: Data migration and validation

The data migration process in SDT is structured, iterative, and tool-driven. It typically includes the following phases:

  • Data preparation, where data scope, selection criteria, and mapping rules are defined.
  • Data extraction, which pulls the relevant data from the ECC source system.
  • Data transformation, where the data is adapted to fit the S/4HANA data model.
  • Pre-validation, to identify issues before loading.
  • System preparation, including technical readiness of the target system.
  • Data load, the actual transfer into S/4HANA.
  • Post-load validation, which includes detailed comparisons, audits, and functional checks.

The most commonly used migration method in SDT is the table-based approach, which enables high-throughput, flexible migrations at the database level. It allows for the selective transfer of historical data, supports large volumes, and can be tailored to different business objects. For open items and balances, the posting-based approach may also be used, with built-in validations that ensure transactional integrity. In complex scenarios, a hybrid of both methods is often applied.

Building trust through comprehensive validation

Validation in SDT goes far beyond technical correctness. Migration partners first review system logs and data protocols, then conduct detailed comparisons between the source and target systems. These include data consistency checks (e.g. foreign key validations), automated batch testing of key processes, and audit-level validations such as balance sheet reconciliations.

Customers typically perform additional manual spot checks and simulate key transactions to confirm the system behaves as expected. This collaborative process ensures confidence in the final result and smooth handover before go-live.

Downtime and performance: Planning for business continuity

For most customers, minimizing downtime is a top priority. A variety of factors affect what’s achievable: from the total volume of data, to system complexity, to infrastructure performance. SDT places strong emphasis on hardware readiness, proper system tuning, and cutover orchestration. A clear organizational structure and a well-rehearsed cutover plan are just as important as the technical components.

When standard migration methods aren’t fast enough, Near-Zero Downtime (NZDT)techniques are introduced. This method uses database triggers to track changes during business uptime, allowing most of the migration to happen while the system remains live. Only the last changes—captured in one or more delta loads—are migrated during a short cutover window. With this approach, companies can complete even large-scale migrations within a weekend or less.

Automated reconciliation tools also play a key role in simplifying post-migration checks. Instead of manually reviewing audit reports and comparing data across systems (a process that’s often tedious, time-consuming, and prone to errors) these tools automate much of the effort. They compare key artifacts, flag discrepancies, and help determine whether any differences are explainable, ultimately saving time and reducing the risk of human error. So, these two factors - NZDT methodology and automated reconciliation tools - are key drivers in helping customers meet their downtime requirements.

Low-risk transformation that meets the real business needs

Selective Data Transition offers a pragmatic, scalable path to S/4HANA for companies that want to modernize without leaving behind years of business-critical data and custom development. Whether through a shell system, mix-and-match setup, or phased integration into an existing landscape, SDT offers the flexibility to match your strategy.

With the right combination of tooling, governance, and preparation, including strong validation and downtime planning, SDT enables a technically sound, low-risk transformation that meets the real needs of the business.

entry.title: How Does Selective Data Transition (SDT) Work Technically?
entry.content:
Behind the Scenes of a Flexible S/4HANA Migration

As SAP ECC customers prepare for the transition to S/4HANA, more organizations are turning to Selective Data Transition (SDT) as a flexible alternative to Brownfield and Greenfield approaches. Here’s what you need to know.

It begins with a 1:1 copy of the existing ECC system, excluding master and transactional data, while retaining all customizing and repository objects. It’s ideal for organizations with valuable custom developments they want to retain while still pursuing innovation.

entry.title: S/4HANA EHS Risk Assessment - Delivery of List REACH-SVHC
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

in S/4HANA EHS for Workplace Safety (component EHS-SUS-HS, not SAP EHS for Safety data sheet and dangerous goods) the regulatory lists REACH-SVHC, ROHS and REACH-ANNEX 14 were delivered via SAP Notes. 

(Note 2427915, Note 2116459) 

In newer releases S/4 On Premise 2023 the above mentioned notes cannot be implemented. 

Are the regulatory lists REACH-SVHC, ROHS and REACH-ANNEX 14 still delivered and updated by SAP?

Thank you

Duc

entry.title: Influencing posting price at GR with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE
entry.content:
Hi there.

We are trying to influence the material price when posting a goods receipt with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE.
Therefore we are using the field AMOUNT_LC of structure GOODSMVT_ITEM. 

According to it"s documentation (BAPI_EXBWR) this field can be used for

"The value of the movement is calculated automatically by the system. However, it is possible to enter an amount manually if the item is to be valuated at a different price."

But is seems this documentation is not accurate, since when we are setting a different price in structure GOODSMVT_ITEM-AMOUNT_LC only MSEG-EXBWR gets updated with this, but not MSEG-DMBTR which is the base for the valuation of the material document. 
Is it really possible to influence the price with field AMOUNT_LC in BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE?
Maybe someone made the same experience and has a solution for it
Somehow the documentation of  BAPI_EXBWR seems to be misleading.

Thank you very much in advance
Best regards

Heinz

entry.title: Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?
entry.content:
Question

Is it possible to separate the calculation of interest rates by customizing?

The invoice and accounting require the amounts of each interest rate to be displayed separately.

 

Analysis 

 At the customer XXXXX, it is required that the FINT transaction calculates and settles the interest and the surcharge separately. At this moment, in the test, the settlement of interest and the surcharge is totaled for the calculation, and thus it is carried to the generated accounting document.  

The client requires that the amount of interest (in this case 18%) be shown separately from the surcharge (in this case 2%) in the accounting records.

entry.title: capacity scheduling table dispatch error: Order &1 is not consistent as it was modified externally
entry.content:
hi, expert

    There is an error info "Order &1 is not consistent as it was modified externally" and "Order &1 could not be scheduled due to a technical error", when i use capacity scheduling table App "dispatch" or " realign scheduling", my system is S/4HANA 2022 FAA  on-premise. Could you give me some advice  to resolve this problem?

entry.title: Parameter id “UKM_SEGMENT” value doesn’t automatically pop up in tr.Code “UKM_CASE”?
entry.content:
Hi,

Although parameter id “UKM_SEGMENT” value has been set to “ES20” in my S4H user account, this field value doesn’t automatically pop up in tr.Code “UKM_CASE”? How to default the Credit Segment field in tr.Code “UKM_CASE”?

And thanks in advance for your kind help

entry.title: Consignment Stock Update is not updated based on Ship to Customer in MSKU
entry.content:
We are using the SAP consignment stock process where the consignment stock is placed at a customer location. The stocks are required to be tracked based on where the stocks have been placed. However, the MSKU table does not record the consignment stock at the Ship to customer level and is recording the stock at the sold to level due to which there is a loss of information and visibility of the stock at a customer location. 

Please advise.

Regards

Rohit Zalani

entry.title: need to make the Invoice Receipt Date mandatory for Fiori App Create Supplier Invoice (F0859)
entry.content:
Hi Team,

How is possible to make the field "Invoice Receipt Date" mandatory in the Create Supplier Invoice App?

Thank you!

entry.title: Capacity Scheduling Table: no select all button
entry.content:
hi, expert, 

 I can't find the select all button on the Capactiy Scheduling Table for select orders,  just can Deselect All orders.

My S/4HANA system version is  2022 on-premise.

entry.title: freight-cost-condition divided per position in outbound delivery the same as at sales documents.
entry.content:
For example situation now : 

ZFRE= our freight-condition. | ZFRE= 10 euro. 

So order situation:

Product X | 2 pieces | 10 euro p/piece | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*20 = 8 euro. 

  • 10 = ZFRE-freight. 
  • 25 comes from 10+10+5 total document costs.
  • 20=10+10 this position.

Product Y | 1 piece | 5 euro p/piece | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*5 = 2 euro. 

  • 10 = ZFRE-freight. 
  • 25 comes from 10+10+5 total document costs.
  • 5= this position.

first outbound delivery / billing document:

Product X with 1 less piece:

Product X | 1 pieces | 10 euro | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*10 = 4 euro. 

Product Y | 1 piece | 5 euro | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*5 = 2 euro. 

SAP waits for next outbound deliveries for further ZFRE of 10-4-2=4 euro on position 1. 

--------------------------------------------------

Question: how to:

order situation same:

Product X | 2 pieces | 10 euro p/piece | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*20 = 8 euro. 

Product Y | 1 piece | 5 euro p/piece | therefore : ZFRE = 10/25*5 = 2 euro. 

first delivery/billing document:

Product X with 1 piece on position 1 : 

Product X | 1 pieces |10 euro | ZFRE = 10/15*10 = 6.67 euro. 

Product Y | 1 piece |5 euro | ZFRE=10/15*5 = 3.33 euro. 

 

So we want:

At first delivery we want the 10 euro freight divided but calculated based on positions at outbound delivery. Next upcoming deliveries are then without freight costs because it is already payed. How could we do this ?

entry.title: How to add Custom Fields In BP transaction In customer Role.
entry.content:
Hey SAP Folk,

I have an requirement to add custom field in Business partner(BP) Transaction code in my customer special role.
I have few fields like 'Manager Name', 'Contact details' etc. and want to add these fields in new custom tab also i want to to flow the custom fields data to their respective Standard tables.

How could i do that??

Can i add fields in new custom fields tab or the tab which are present itself there.

Please help me in solving this issue.

APP PLATFORM Business Partner  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition  SAP S/4HANA business partner

entry.title: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes (GR & Cost Split)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm exploring a business requirement involving two company codes and would appreciate your insights:

  • Company Code 1 creates a Purchase Order to a supplier.

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods (Goods Receipt) against that PO.

  • Company Code 1 is responsible for paying the material cost.

  • Company Code 2 is responsible for paying the customs/duties related to the import.

My current approach:

  • Company Code 1 issues the PO to the supplier,

  • Then an Intercompany STO is created from Company Code 1 to Company Code 2 (Free of Charge),

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods via the STO.

However, this adds complexity and time to the process.

Question:
Is there any alternative or simplified solution in SAP S/4HANA that allows:

  • Company Code 1 to issue the PO,

  • Company Code 2 to post the Goods Receipt directly against that PO,

  • And each company code to handle their respective costs (material vs. customs)?

We would appreciate any advice on configurations, custom enhancements, or standard processes that might help here.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Transport the service Catalogue Issue
entry.content:
Dear Team,

I have facing an issue in DS4 100 from "/n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE" of creating transport for the Service catalogue. For the configured service C_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHYNODE_SRV,  While clicking the Add to Transport, getting the below message. Even clicking the option Yes, no option for creating transport. Please do the needful support

This will overwrite "Soft State" and "Processing Mode" for selected service in target systems. Continue?

entry.title: BAPI/FM to create Service Contract in S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I have a requirement for a mass upload program for service contract creation in S/4HANA system, with clean core approach in mind. I understand that the BAPIs with CRM* names are obsolete in S/4HANA. I found BAPI  BAPI_CONTRACT_CREATEFROMDATA but it is in "not released" status so that is a no-go. 

Can anyone please advise what I can do to fulfill this requirement? The service contract in SD - created in VA41.

Your help is much appreciated! Thank you.

entry.title: Mass deletion of MARD entries for a specific storage location without affecting MARC/MARA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently facing the following challenge and would appreciate any advice from the community:

We want to delete a specific storage location (e.g., an external warehouse) from the material master storage location data (MARD) — for all affected materials (~300,000) — without touching any entries in MARC or MARA.

Goal:
Only remove the MARD entries for this storage location – essentially, delete the storage location view from the material master.

Conditions:

  • The same material can exist in multiple storage locations, but only the specified one should be deleted

  • The external storage location is no longer used

  • This should be done per storage location, not per material

My questions:

  1. Has anyone used MM17 for this kind of mass deletion?

  2. Are there any limitations in using MM17 for deleting storage location views in MARD?

  3. Are there alternatives?

  4. Is it supported/safe to delete MARD records directly via standard tools, or is it considered risky?

Any feedback or shared experience would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance and best regards,

K. Xhyra
